Object.name: ArrayCore
Object.description: Core objects for array processing of ambient vibrations

Object.name: ArrayGui
Object.description: Gui objects for array processing of ambient vibrations

Object.name: DinverCore
Object.description: Dinver core library: implementation of core engine for Neighborhood Algorithm modified after Wathelet (2008).

Object.name: DinverDCCore
Object.description: Core objects of dinverdc plugin: inversion of dispersion curves and related objects.

Object.name: DinverDCGui
Object.description: Gui objects of dinverdc plugin: inversion of dispersion curves and related objects.

Object.name: DinverGui
Object.description: Graphical components of dinver core engine.

Object.name: GeopsyCore
Object.description: Core library for geopsy signal database: signal processing and signal accessibility. Reads many seismic formats and can access seed links through a high level API.

Object.name: GeopsyGui
Object.description: Gui part of geopsy core librairies. The main object is an efficient signal plot. Interface for geopsy plugins.

Object.name: GeopsySLink
Object.description: Core components for the management of seedlink stream

Object.name: GeopsySLinkGui
Object.description: Graphical components for the management of seedlink stream

Object.name: MonoStation
Object.description: Core objects of mainly geopsyhv plugin

Object.name: QGpCompatibility
Object.description: Compatibility with old sesarray release. Especially, objects related to inversion: reports.

Object.name: QGpCoreTools
Object.description: Basic library which links only to QtCore (without references to gui features): math, expression, messages, cache, xml, tar, memory, crash,...

Object.name: QGpCoreWave
Object.description: Implementation of seismic wave tools: dispersion curve, elliptiicty curve, eigen function of Love and Rayleigh waves, travel time computation (1D and 3D, Podvin).

Object.name: QGpGuiTools
Object.description: Basic library which links to QtGui (with references to gui features): bug report, column text parser, properties dialog, dialog settings, log viewer,...

Object.name: QGpGuiWave
Object.description: Gui objects linked to qgpcorewave library: graphical handling of dispersion curves, refraction curves,...

Object.name: SciFigs
Object.description: Graphical plots: 2D plots, graphic sheet, legend, color palette.

Object.name: WaranCore
Object.description: Core library for WARAN acquisition system.

Object.name: dfftpack
Object.description: Fast Fourier Transform

Object.name: dinver
Object.description: Graphical environment to solve inversion problem using Neighborhood Algorithm or Monte-Carlo sampling. Various plugins are proposed here for solving common problems. You can define your own based on the template provided here below.

Object.name: dinverdc
Object.description: Inversion of dispersion curves (Rayleigh, Love, Phase and Group velocities, higher modes), autocorrelation curves, ellipticity curves, ellipticity peak and refraction travel times. Joint inversion are also possible.

Object.name: dinverext
Object.description: Plugin to run the forward computation in an external command.

Object.name: fastmap
Object.description: Quick drawing of precise maps

Object.name: figue
Object.description: Figure edition. A graphical tool to merge various plots picked in all other geopsy softwares. Creating XY plot from command line is a breeze. It can also export to ps, pdf and bitmap image formats.

Object.name: geopsy
Object.description: Graphical environment to view, organize and process signals. Most of the geophysical file formats are automatically recognized. Geopsy features can be extended through plugin tools. A selection is available here below.

Object.name: geopsyarray
Object.description: Plugin tool to extract dispersion/autocorrelation curves from arrays of stations. It includes processing for both passive and active recordings. Main contributions from M. Ohrnberger and A. Khoeler (University of Potsdam).

Object.name: geopsydamping
Object.description: Plugin tool to compute damping: based on random decrement for a single station measurement. Based on original Phd work of F. Dunant (LGIT, 2005, These_fdunand.pdf).

Object.name: geopsyfigs
Object.description: Plugin needed to export graphic signal from Geopsy to Figue.

Object.name: geopsyhv
Object.description: Plugin tool to compute H/V spectral ratios from single station ambient vibrations. A sub-product from SESAME European project (2001-2004) with main contributions from J.-L. Chatelain (aka 'Gaillot'), B. Guillier and P.-Y. Bard (LGIT).

Object.name: geopsynr
Object.description: Plugin tool to increase (or to try to) the signal to noise ratio in active seismic. Basic and enhanced stacking technique. T0 adjustment (even to a fraction of sampling period).

Object.name: geopsypackinstall
Object.description: Install/uninstall system tool for geopsy packages

Object.name: geopsyptmotion
Object.description: Plugin tool to plot particle motion from 3-component recordings (projection on all planes).

Object.name: geopsyrefra
Object.description: Plugin tool to pipe picked arrival times from Geopsy to Dinver.

Object.name: geopsytfa
Object.description: Plugin tool to compute a time-frequency analysis based on Morlet wavelet. Main contributions from M. Kristekova (University of Bratislava).

Object.name: gpcoord
Object.description: Coordinate X,Y oprations: distance, azimuth, conversion from/to lat/long,...

Object.name: gpcurve
Object.description: Curve processing: resample, cut, interpolate, derivate, integrate,... Exactly the same actions as inside Dinver (module dinvedc) but through a command line. It can also sample an analytical expression to generate functions.

Object.name: gpdc
Object.description: Computation of theoretical dispersion curves.

Object.name: gpdcmisfit
Object.description: Recomputation of misfit. Did you generate a collection of models that you want to use as the starting population for slightly different dispersion curve? No problem, correct misfits and import it.

Object.name: gpdcreport
Object.description: Query tool for binary inversion report produced by dinverdc. With option '-pm' this tool is also usefull for all report types produced by dinver (e.g. dinvermatlab, dinverext or any custom inversion plugin).

Object.name: gpdepths
Object.description: Generates standard thicknesses (that follow a gemetrical progrssion) and corresponding 1D parameterizations.

Object.name: gpdistance
Object.description: Calculates distances and azimuth between named points (aka stations). Uses a lookup table for station coordinates. Such lookup is difficult to implement with awk, the reason for writing it in C++.

Object.name: gpec8
Object.description: Output EC8 soil category from a 1D wave model. Classification here is based only on Vs profiles. The official classification includes other parameters not covered by this tool.

Object.name: gpell
Object.description: Computation of theoretical ellipticity curves.

Object.name: gpfksimulator
Object.description: Educational tool for FK array response

Object.name: gpgroup2phase
Object.description: Convert group velocity dispersion curves to phase velocity. Hmm! The solution is not unique. Ok this tool scans for various possibilities.

Object.name: gphistogram
Object.description: Constucts interactive 2D histograms from any data set (couples X, Y).

Object.name: gplivemodel
Object.description: Interactive computation of theoretical dispsersion curves, ellipticity curves,... through a graphical interface which lets you playing with cursors to adjust model parameters.

Object.name: gpmodel2param
Object.description: Transforms a 1D wave model into a ground parameterization that you can import inside Dinver (dinverdc plugin).

Object.name: gpparam2model
Object.description: Generate 1D wave models given a parameter set and a parameterization definition.

Object.name: gppoisson
Object.description: A memo for Poisson's ratio formula. Quick transform from Vp, Vs to nu and vice-versa.

Object.name: gpprofile
Object.description: Transform a 1D wave model into a plotable curve. Can also compute a variety of useful profiles from 1D wave models: impedance, Poisson's ration, travel time average (Vs30 or VsZ).

Object.name: gprandom
Object.description: Computes random values with ran2 (uniform probability, support for lot of computations).

Object.name: gprefra
Object.description: Computation of theoretical refraction travel times (1D model or tilted model).

Object.name: gpreplace
Object.description: Text replacement using regular expression. Support more features than grep or sed, it can handle patterns over several lines.

Object.name: gpsh
Object.description: Computation of theoretical SH transfer function for a 1D wave model (Fortran implementation from P.-Y. Bard, LGIT).

Object.name: gpsignal
Object.description: Computation of custom cosine signals. Stacks of multiple frequencies and phases. Support for phase shifts between various station locations.

Object.name: gpsort
Object.description: Sort curves stored in a text file (one after the other, various columns for X, Y,...). Usefull to re-order curves produced by gpspac and pipe them to figue in the correct order (play with option '-cpp').

Object.name: gpspac
Object.description: Computation of theoretical autocorrelation curves.

Object.name: gptarget
Object.description: Manipulation of dinver targets through command line. This tool can add, delete, or extract curves to or from .target files.

Object.name: gptime
Object.description: Converts time formats.

Object.name: gptomoinfo
Object.description: Extract files fsrc, fsta, fobs (for tomography codes) from a geopsy database or vice-versa

Object.name: gpviewdcreport
Object.description: Ploting tool for report files produced by dinverdc plugin. Provides the same output as inside Dinver graphical interface for automatic bash scripts.

Object.name: kephren_plugin
Object.description: Alignment of sampling for seed stream from Kephren stations

Object.name: kephrenrtu
Object.description: Kephren Ready To Use transforms titan files (using rtitan2) into sac files ready for array processing (high pass filter, time corrections, sampling alignment).

Object.name: max2curve
Object.description: Post processing tool for dispersion curves obtained from geopsyarray plugin tool. Mainly statistical analysis.

Object.name: mseed
Object.description: Access to mini seed format

Object.name: slink
Object.description: Access to seed link protocol

Object.name: spac2disp
Object.description: Post processing tools for SPAC method. Check consistency between autocorr curves computed for various rings. Based on original work from Wathelet et al. (2005). Support for 1C and 3C analysis.

Object.name: structureratios
Object.description: Plugin tool to compute spectral ratios for artificial structures (buildings, bridges,...). Main contributions from J.-L. Chatelain (aka 'Gaillot') and B. Guillier.

Object.name: vslarray
Object.description: Virtual Seedlink Array: emulate a real-time WARAN acquisition from a Geopsy database. Requires the installation of Seiscomp>=2.6 with mscan plugin

Object.name: waran
Object.description: Real-time analysis of ambient vibration arrays for WARAN aquisition system

Object.name: warangps
Object.description: GPS Positioning for WARAN aquisition system. Replaces build_array for theoretical array response computation.

Object.name: waranmon
Object.description: Station monitoring tool for WARAN aquisition system
